summary: The Concrete and Asphalt Innovation Act of 2025 aims to enhance the competitiveness of US cement, concrete, and asphalt industries while reducing emissions. It establishes a research program to develop low-emission production technologies, a demonstration initiative to showcase these technologies, and a technical assistance program. It also supports Manufacturing USA institutes focused on these materials, provides financial incentives to states for using low-emission materials in highway projects, and creates an interagency task force to provide recommendations and facilitate adoption of these innovative technologies. The bill amends existing legislation to allow for advance purchase contracts for innovative materials.
